tech_news.title: Apple’s $230 Cloth iPhone Pouch Is Already Sold Out — Here’s What It’s Like - Bloomberg.com
tech_news.description: Early Friday, a crowd of people lined up outside Apple Inc.’s SoHo location in New York to be among the first to get their hands on a new, limited-edition product: an up to $230 iPhone pouch the company said is “inspired by the concept of a piece of cloth.”

tech_news.title: Sony’s Concord Is Playable Again Thanks To Fan-Made Custom Servers - The Game Post
tech_news.description: Concord is not completely dead. Community developers have brought Sony's shut-down hero shooter back online with fan-made custom servers, rebuilding its backend API and getting full matches running again.

Critical Microsoft Alert — Update Windows 10, 11 And Server Right Now - Forbes
tech_news.description: Microsoft has confirmed a zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Kernel that attackers have already exploited to gain system privileges. Act now.

tech_news.title: Valve is making microSD cards the next game cartridges - The Verge
tech_news.description: Valve’s new Steam Machine PC and Steam Frame VR headset both have a microSD card slot, meaning you can easily move games across systems.

tech_news.title: Rockstar's beloved cowboy epic Red Dead Redemption coming to current gen consoles and mobile next month in free update - Eurogamer
tech_news.description: Red Read Redemption will next month receive a free update for current gen consoles, as well as a release across mobile devices and Netflix.
